entry.title: HTB Alert Writeup (Walkthrough)
entry.summary: INFO Machine IP = 10.10.11.44 OS = Linux Level = EASY Points = 20 Summary In this challenge, multiple web vulnerabilities were chained to gain a foothold and ultimately escalate privileges. This writeup explains the process step by step, detailing not only the exploits but also the key tools, protocols, and command-line usage that helped drive the attack. entry.title: HTB BoardLight Writeup
entry.summary: 10.10.14.36 INFO Machine IP = 10.10.11.11 OS = Linux Level = EASY Points = 20 Add the IP of the machine to your /etc/hosts file echo "10.10.11.11 board.htb" &gt;&gt; /etc/hosts Scanning nmap -sC -sV 10.10.11.11 Enumeration 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 8.2p1 Ubuntu 4ubuntu0.11 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0) | ssh-hostkey: | 3072 06:2d:3b:85:10:59:ff:73:66:27:7f:0e:ae:03:ea:f4 (R...

entry.title: SQL injection with filter bypass via XML encoding

link.title: SQL injection with filter bypass via XML encoding

entry.summary: üî¨ LAB: This lab contains a SQL injection vulnerability in its stock check feature. The results from the query are returned in the application‚Äôs response, so you can use a UNION attack to retrieve data from other tables. The database contains a users table, which contains the usernames and passwords of registered users. To solve the lab, perform a SQL injection attack to retrieve the admin use...

entry.title: Visible error-based SQL injection
entry.summary: üî¨ LAB: This lab contains a SQL injection vulnerability. The application uses a tracking cookie for analytics, and performs a SQL query containing the value of the submitted cookie. The results of the SQL query are not returned. The database contains a different table called users, with columns called username and password. To solve the lab, find a way to leak the password for the administrato...
